choices.B: It refreshes all users learned through agentless polling.
choices.D: It enables agentless polling mode real-time debug.
choices.A: It refreshes user group information form any servers connected to the FortiGate using a collector agent.
choices.C: It displays status information and some statistics related with the polls done by FortiGate on each DC.

questions.question_text: What does the command diagnose debug fsso-polling refresh-user do?

choices.A: The FortiGate is able to handle NATed connections only with aggressive mode.
choices.D: Main mode does not support XAuth for user authentication.
choices.C: The remote peers are able to provide their peer IDs in the first message with aggressive mode.

questions.question_text: Why must you use aggressive mode when a local FortiGate IPsec gateway hosts multiple dialup tunnels?

choices.D: Creates a session for traffic being denied.
choices.A: Reduces the amount of logs generated by denied traffic.
choices.B: Enforces device detection on all interfaces for 30 minutes.
FortiGate uses port 8080 for log transmission
choices.D: FortiGate can encrypt communications using SSL encrypted OFTP traffic.
choices.C: Log messages are transmitted as plain text in LZ4 compressed format (store-and-upload method).
choices.A: Logs must be stored on FortiGate first, before transmitting to FortiAnalyzer

questions.question_text: An administrator needs to offload logging to FortiAnalyzer from a FortiGate with an internal hard drive. Which statements are true? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: The answer should be A and D

choices.A: Browsers can be configured to retrieve this PAC file from the FortiGate.
choices.B: Any web request to the 172.25.120.0/24 subnet is allowed to bypass the proxy.
choices.C: All requests not made to Fortinet.com or the 172.25.120.0/24 subnet, have to go through altproxy.corp.com: 8060.
choices.D: Any web request fortinet.com is allowed to bypass the proxy.
